item.title: Ryan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Did you ever want to set someone's head on fire, just to see what it looked like? Did you ever stand in the street and think to yourself, I could make that nun go blind just by giving her a kiss? Did you ever lay out plans for stitching babies and stray cats into a Perfect New Human? Did you ever stand naked surrounded by people who want your gleaming sperm, squirting frankincense, soma and testosterone from every pore? If so, then you're the bastard who stole my drugs Friday night. And I'll find you. Oh, yes." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "You're miserable, edgy and tired. You're in the perfect mood for journalism." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Drinking is fun! It makes me feel horrible and sexy!" -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "For every reader who dies today, a viewer is born, and we seem to be witnessing . . . the final tipping balance." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Most of us are called on to perform tasks far beyond what we can do. Our capabilities seldom match our aspirations, and we are often woefully unprepared. To this extent, we are all Assistant Pig-Keepers at heart." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I hate you, God. I hate you as though you actually exist." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Frank Bidart
item.description:
"then the voice in my head said
WHETHER YOU LOVE WHAT YOU LOVE
OR LIVE IN DIVIDED CEASELESS REVOLT AGAINST IT
WHAT YOU LOVE IS YOUR FATE " -- Frank Bidart

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Arthur Nersesian
item.description: "Finally life becomes a very specific thing--and that's what we are. Ultimately, looking back, I'm beginning to believe that we need to always be fucked up. We need to always have some reason to hate ourselves, something to make us feel eternally incomplete." -- Arthur Nersesian

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Jonathan Lethem
item.description: "Those promises we make to ourselves when we are younger, about how we mean to conduct our adult lives, can it be true we break every last one of them? All except for one, I suppose: the promise to judge ourselves by those standards, the promise to remember the child who would be so appalled by compromise, the child who would find jadedness wicked." -- Jonathan Lethem

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Jonathan Lethem
item.description: "For those whose ganglia were formed pre-TV, the mimetic deployment of pop-culture icons seems at best an annoying tic and at worst a dangerous vapidity that compromises fiction's seriousness by dating it out of the Platonic Always, where it ought to reside." -- Jonathan Lethem

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Jonathan Lethem
item.description: "I learned to write fiction the way I learned to read fiction - by skipping the parts that bored me. " -- Jonathan Lethem

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Jonathan Lethem
item.description: "Tourette's is just one big lifetime of tag, really. The world (or my brain---same thing) appoints me it, again and again. So I tag back. Can it do otherwise? If you've ever been it you know the answer." -- Jonathan Lethem

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "An artist's only concern is to shoot for some kind of perfection, and on his own terms, not anyone else's." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "My god, there's absolutely nothing tenth-rate about you, and yet you're up to your neck at this minute in tenth-rate thinking." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "You're lucky if you get time to sneeze in this goddam phenomenal world." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The necessary thing is after all but this; solitude, great inner solitude. Going into oneself for hours meeting no one - this one must be able to attain." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for to the creator there is no poverty and no poor indifferent place." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Let everything happen to you Beauty and terror Just keep going No feeling is final" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Ryan add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Ryan add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Fiction is one of the few experiences where loneliness can be both confronted and relieved. Drugs, movies where stuff blows up, loud parties -- all these chase away loneliness by making me forget my name's Dave and I live in a one-by-one box of bone no other party can penetrate or know. Fiction, poetry, music, really deep serious sex, and, in various ways, religion -- these are the places (for me) where loneliness is countenanced, stared down, transfigured, treated." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Ryan add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Because here's something else that's weird but true: in the day-to day trenches of adult life, there is actually no such thing as atheism. There is no such thing as not worshipping. Everybody worships. The only choice we get is what to worship. And the compelling reason for maybe choosing some sort of god or spiritual-type thing to worship -- be it JC or Allah, be it YHWH or the Wiccan Mother Goddess, or the Four Noble Truths, or some inviolable set of ethical principles -- is that pretty much anything else you worship will eat you alive. If you worship money and things, if they are where you tap real meaning in life, then you will never have enough, never feel you have enough. It's the truth. Worship your body and beauty and sexual allure and you will always feel ugly. And when time and age start showing, you will die a million deaths before they finally grieve you. On one level, we all know this stuff already. It's been codified as myths, proverbs, clichÃ©s, epigrams, parables; the skeleton of every great story. The whole trick is keeping the truth up front in daily consciousness." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Ryan add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "In dark times, the definition of good art would seem to be art that locates and applies CPR to those elements of what's human and magical that still live and glow despite the times' darkness. Really good fiction could have as dark a worldview as it wished, but it'd find a way both to depict this world and to illuminate the possibilities for being alive and human in it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Ryan add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "You have decided being scared is caused mostly by thinking. " -- David Foster Wallace
